oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wyley McPherson Interview by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Wyley McPherson by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 08-05-1982
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wyley McPherson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:54) -- Wyley McPherson discusses working with Chips and Steve Cropper on a song for David Houston. Continued discussion about John Lomax's bio article about Wyley McPherson. (1:21) -- Wyley McPherson emphasizes the importance of his image. (3:46) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson about what he thinks of the current state of country music. He mentions that he thinks country music today would've been pop music when he was growing up. (4:46) -- Jerry Taylor emphasizes the importance of John Lomax selling Wyley McPherson as an attractive man. (7:45) -- Wyley McPherson clarifies what he would like towards the end of his bio feature by John Lomax. (10:02) -- Wyley McPherson clarifies that Jerry Taylor is producing his new records. (10:35) -- Wyley McPherson mentions that his gold coins are worth $325. Jerry Taylor informs John Lomax that he should sell Wyley McPherson. (12:04) --John Lomax mentions the stage presence of Bruce Springsteen. (12:40) -- Wyley McPherson emphasizes the importance of fan service and "gimmicks."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Richey, Paul; McPherson, Wyley;
